wikipedia_page.main: David McKie Loggie (born 31 May 1957) is an English retired professional footballer who played as a striker. After playing in the Football League with Burnley and York City, he had a successful career in The Netherlands and Belgium.

response: Born in Dordrecht, van der Gijp started playing football at local side DFC. In 1975, he started playing in the Feyenoord youth academy with the likes of Hans Kraay Jr.. After a year, however, he was sent away from Feyenoord and moved to Sparta Rotterdam on the advice of Hans Kraay Sr. Two years later, van der Gijp made his debut in the first team, which counted players such as Louis van Gaal, Arie van Staveren, Luuk Balkestein, Adri van Tiggelen, Danny Blind, Ruud Geels, Ronald Lengkeek, Gerard van der Lem, Geert Meijer, Dick Advocaat and David Loggie.

link_mentions.page: List of foreign football players in the Netherlands
response: *David Loggie – Sparta Rotterdam, AZ, Willem II – 1980–82, 1983–91
